title.value: What if We Enrich day-ahead Solar Irradiance Time Series Forecasting with Spatio-Temporal Context?
title.justification: Paper title provided at the beginning
title.quote: What if We Enrich day-ahead Solar Irradiance Time Series Forecasting with Spatio-Temporal Context?

extractions.description: This research paper presents a deep learning architecture named CrossViViT designed to utilize spatio-temporal satellite data for highly accurate day-ahead Global Horizontal Irradiance (GHI) forecasting. The work includes developing a Multi-Quantile version of the model, which outputs a prediction interval for each time-step to measure forecasting uncertainty. The paper also introduces a testing scheme to evaluate model performance in varying cloud conditions, crucial for effective solar power integration into electrical grids.

type.justification: The paper involves development and empirical evaluation of a new deep learning architecture on a dataset.
type.quote: We conduct a comprehensive comparison between our approach and several state-of-the-art deep learning architectures and propose tailored baselines for solar irradiance forecasting.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on forecasting solar irradiance using time series data from satellite images.
name.quote: We present a deep learning architecture which uses spatio-temporal context from satellite data for highly accurate day-ahead time-series forecasting

name.justification: The model uses satellite images as part of its multimodal inputs for forecasting.
name.quote: We address these gaps by incorporating satellite imaging for solar irradiance forecasting and propose a multi-modal architecture capable of forecasting in principle any physical variable.

name.justification: The application domain of the study is forecasting solar irradiance, which is crucial for solar energy utilization.
name.quote: Accurate solar irradiance forecasting can help grid operators manage this variability, leading to more efficient and reliable grid integration of solar power

name.justification: Explicitly mentioned as the deep learning architecture developed and evaluated in the paper.
name.quote: We develop CrossViViT, a deep learning architecture that uses spatio-temporal context (including satellite data) for highly accurate day-ahead time-series forecasting at any station, even those unseen during training, with a particular focus on GHI.

is_contributed.justification: The model is presented as a novel contribution in this research paper.
is_contributed.quote: We develop CrossViViT, a deep learning architecture.

is_executed.justification: The paper involves the practical application and running of the model.
is_executed.quote: The models employ a sliding window approach, using 24-hour historical input to predict the next 24-hour Global Horizontal Irradiance (GHI).

is_compared.justification: The model is compared with various baselines and state-of-the-art models in the experiments section.
is_compared.quote: We conduct a comprehensive comparison between our approach and several state-of-the-art deep learning architectures and propose tailored baselines for solar irradiance forecasting.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The architecture is influenced by the ViViT model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: This framework is influenced by recent video transformer models (Arnab et al., 2021; Feichtenhofer et al., 2022) and multi-modal models that use diverse data sources such as images and time series (Liu et al., 2023).

name.justification: The dataset used in the study is explicitly specified as coming from the BSRN.
name.quote: This study uses 15 years (2008-2022) of radiation data from six locations, collected at 30-minute intervals from the Baseline Surface Radiation Network (BSRN).
